truth: -  "The periodic table is divided into periods (horizontal rows) and groups (vertical columns)."
fiction: -  "The periodic table is divided into chapters (horizontal rows) and verses (vertical columns)."

truth: -  "The atomic number of an element corresponds to the number of protons in its nucleus."
fiction: -  "The atomic number of an element corresponds to the number of electrons in its outer shell."

truth: -  "Noble gases, found in Group 18 of the periodic table, are known for their low reactivity."
fiction: -  "Noble gases, found in Group 18 of the periodic table, are known for their high flammability."

truth: -  "Elements in the same group of the periodic table have similar chemical properties."
fiction: -  "Elements in the same group of the periodic table have similar physical appearances."

truth: -  "The first element on the periodic table, hydrogen, has one proton."
fiction: -  "The first element on the periodic table, hydrogen, has one neutron."

truth: -  "Transition metals are found in the middle of the periodic table."
fiction: -  "Transition metals are found at the far right of the periodic table."

truth: -  "Alkali metals, found in Group 1 of the periodic table, are highly reactive."
fiction: -  "Alkali metals, found in Group 1 of the periodic table, are highly inert."

truth: -  "The atomic mass of an element is approximately equal to the number of protons and neutrons in its nucleus."
fiction: -  "The atomic mass of an element is approximately equal to the number of electrons in its outer shell."

truth: -  "Elements on the left side of the periodic table are metals, while those on the right are non-metals."
fiction: -  "Elements on the left side of the periodic table are gases, while those on the right are liquids."

truth: -  "The periodic table currently contains 118 confirmed elements."
fiction: -  "The periodic table currently contains 500 confirmed elements."

truth: -  "The lanthanides and actinides are two series of elements found at the bottom of the periodic table."
fiction: -  "The lanthanides and actinides are two series of elements found at the top of the periodic table."

truth: -  "Elements in the same period of the periodic table have the same number of electron shells."
fiction: -  "Elements in the same period of the periodic table have the same number of protons."

truth: -  "The halogens, found in Group 17 of the periodic table, are highly reactive non-metals."
fiction: -  "The halogens, found in Group 17 of the periodic table, are highly reactive metals."

truth: -  "The atomic number increases by one unit across each element in the periodic table."
fiction: -  "The atomic number decreases by one unit across each element in the periodic table."

truth: -  "The element with the highest atomic number on the periodic table is oganesson, with an atomic number of 118."
fiction: -  "The element with the highest atomic number on the periodic table is helium, with an atomic number of 2."

truth: -  "The periodic table was first proposed by Dmitri Mendeleev in 1869."
fiction: -  "The periodic table was first proposed by Albert Einstein in 1905."

truth: -  "The periodic table is organized by increasing atomic number."
fiction: -  "The periodic table is organized by increasing atomic mass."

truth: -  "The periodic table allows scientists to understand the relationships between various elements."
fiction: -  "The periodic table allows scientists to understand the relationships between various animals."

truth: -  "The elements in Group 2 of the periodic table are known as the alkaline earth metals."
fiction: -  "The elements in Group 2 of the periodic table are known as the noble gases."

truth: -  "The periodic table includes both naturally occurring and synthetically created elements."
fiction: -  "The periodic table includes only elements found on Mars."

truth: -  "The elements in the periodic table are arranged in order of increasing atomic number."
fiction: -  "The elements in the periodic table are arranged in order of increasing melting point."

truth: -  "The periodic table is a tool used by chemists to understand patterns and relationships between elements."
fiction: -  "The periodic table is a tool used by chefs to understand patterns and relationships between ingredients."
